    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(int num,
    int mark)
        Creates a card with a specified suit and value.
        Parameters:
        num - the value of the new card. For a regular card , the value must be in the range 2 through 14, with 14 representing an Ace. You can use the constants PokerCard.ACE, PokerCard.QUEEN, and PokerCard.KING.
        mark - the suit of the new card. This must be one of the values PokerCard.SPADES, PokerCard.HEARTS, PokerCard.DIAMONDS, PokerCard.CLUBS, or PokerCard.JOKER.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter values are not in the Permissible ranges

      • getSuitAsString

        public java.lang.String getSuitAsString()
        Returns a String representation of the card's suit.
        Returns:
        one of the strings "Spades", "Hearts", "Diamonds",or "Clubs".

      • getValueAsString

        public java.lang.String getValueAsString()
        Returns a String representation of the card's value.
        Returns:
        for a regular card, one of the strings "2", "3", ..., "10", "Jack", "Queen", "King" or "Ace". For a Joker, the string is always numerical.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this card, including both its suit and its value . Sample return values are: "Queen of Hearts", "10 of Diamonds" , "Ace of Spades",
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
